awardEventDetails.title: 2009 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (THE OFFICE provides a potent tonic for what ails America in 2008. Creating a consistently funny situation comedy is among television's greatest challenges, and THE OFFICE not only delivers the laughs each week, but grew even stronger this year by peeking into other cubicles and drawing stories from many exceptionally well-realized supporting characters. From flat out farce to touching displays of emotion, THE OFFICE celebrates the maddening dynamics and the embarrassing emotional intimacy of a family - the family we all love and endure at the work place.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2007 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (THE OFFICE is an outrageous ode to the obvious and the oblivious. Each week, this clever comedy celebrates the trivial pursuits of colleagues we all know and love - the deluded, the ignorant, and the trapped, but talented. Steve Carell continues to define himself as a leading man of laughs, here a player within the funniest creative ensemble on television. Together, they make THE OFFICE a place you want to spend your nights.)

AFI Awards, USA

2009 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(THE OFFICE provides a potent tonic for what ails America in 2008. Creating a consistently funny situation comedy is among television's greatest challenges, and THE OFFICE not only delivers the laughs each week, but grew even stronger this year by peeking into other cubicles and drawing stories from many exceptionally well-realized supporting characters. From flat out farce to touching displays of emotion, THE OFFICE celebrates the maddening dynamics and the embarrassing emotional intimacy of a family - the family we all love and endure at the work place.)
2007 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(THE OFFICE is an outrageous ode to the obvious and the oblivious. Each week, this clever comedy celebrates the trivial pursuits of colleagues we all know and love - the deluded, the ignorant, and the trapped, but talented. Steve Carell continues to define himself as a leading man of laughs, here a player within the funniest creative ensemble on television. Together, they make THE OFFICE a place you want to spend your nights.)
